class.name: Frame
class.description: Represents a frame. The Frame object is a member of the Word.FrameCollection object.

properties.name: borders
properties.description: Returns a BorderUniversalCollection object that represents all the borders for the frame.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Specifies the height (in points) of the frame.

properties.name: heightRule
properties.description: Specifies a FrameSizeRule value that represents the rule for determining the height of the frame.

properties.name: horizontalDistanceFromText
properties.description: Specifies the horizontal distance between the frame and the surrounding text, in points.

properties.name: horizontalPosition
properties.description: Specifies the horizontal distance between the edge of the frame and the item specified by the relativeHorizontalPosition property.

properties.name: lockAnchor
properties.description: Specifies if the frame is locked.

properties.name: range
properties.description: Returns a Range object that represents the portion of the document that's contained within the frame.

properties.name: relativeHorizontalPosition
properties.description: Specifies the relative horizontal position of the frame.

properties.name: relativeVerticalPosition
properties.description: Specifies the relative vertical position of the frame.

properties.name: shading
properties.description: Returns a ShadingUniversal object that refers to the shading formatting for the frame.

properties.name: textWrap
properties.description: Specifies if document text wraps around the frame.

properties.name: verticalDistanceFromText
properties.description: Specifies the vertical distance (in points) between the frame and the surrounding text.

properties.name: verticalPosition
properties.description: Specifies the vertical distance between the edge of the frame and the item specified by the relativeVerticalPosition property.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Specifies the width (in points) of the frame.

properties.name: widthRule
properties.description: Specifies the rule used to determine the width of the frame.

methods.name: copy
methods.description: Copies the frame to the Clipboard.

methods.name: cut
methods.description: Removes the frame from the document and places it on the Clipboard.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.Frame object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.FrameData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.
